With a properly tuned progressive tax system, there is no situation where making more money would stop making you more money. You see additional income for each additional dollar you earn. Well calibrate it is perfectly fair, again due to marginal utility. You get diminishing returns from the joy of having more money, so at low income levels a tiny tax level is a huge imposition of the government for the good of us all. The exact same percentage removed for someone just running up the score on the money is just a minor inconvenience, so the government ramps it up to the point where it is a huge imposition. Calibrate the tax code to make it "grudging lesser evil" instead of "huge imposition" and you have what the tax code should be. Completely fair distribution of government misery for the greater good of us all.

Marginal returns. Each additional dollar brings more utility the fewer dollars and individual has on hand. A 20 dollar bill to a starving hobo is a godsend, a 20 dollar bill to a billionaire is a rounding error. Distribute it more evenly and we increase total utility for the society.
Ignoring this argument and morals aside, from a purely self-interested point of view. The rich man just lets those additional dollars sit in his bank account. The poor man has to spend that money on things he needs to live, like food. The person who sells that food gets the dollar, he spends it on a luxury, The rich man sells that luxury, he gets the dollar and lets it sit in his bank account.
So that 1 dollar to the poor man result in 3 separate transactions stimulating the economy, resulting in 3 people having their lives improved, resulting eventually in the exact same end result as if you just gave it to the rich man. Meaning that you had more opportunities to be the person benefiting from the economic transaction.

It's alot easier once you realize that '!' in this context means a [Alveolar click](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alveolar_clicks) as used by several African languages. One example is the Taa language, also referred to as the [X](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taa_language) (pronunciation of that can be found [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zrek3r29HvE feature=youtu.be t=16s)) After that it's pretty standard fare.

Most of history is caused by inexorable historical forces, but there's nothing that would seem to more or less guarantee that the mongols of all people would be able to conqueror the largest land empire ever created. First off, this isn't caused by refresh rate as some people might suggest. That was true of older CRT monitors and modern monitors are mostly LCD. That was caused by the monitor not putting the whole image at the same time and doesn't look like what you are describing.
I'm willing to bet that a [Moir pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moir%C3%A9_pattern) looks more like what you are describing. That's because your screen is a more or less perfect grid of tiny pixels. You're phone's camera is composed of a more or less perfect grid of tiny color sensors. The two grids don't line up, so the patterns interfere with each other, causing the Moir pattern.

The lady who spilled hot coffee on her lap and suing McDonald's. Yes it happened, but the lawsuit was far from frivolous.
For starters she was a septuagenarian, she was in her son's car in the parking lot while the car was stationary when she spilled the coffee on her lap. The coffee was so hot it caused 3rd degree burns, she had to get a skin graft. Her initial lawsuit was just to cover the cost of the extensive hospitalization she needed. The jury ruled that McDonald's coffee was unnecessarily and dangerously hot. It did not need to be at a temperature where 10 seconds of contact with skin would cause severe injury. After the lawsuit they reduced the temperature so it wouldn't be that dangerous, then they went on a smear campaign to discredit her.
